title: Firefox opens google search result links in a new tab as "https://www.google.com/url?sa=..." and nothing in inspector
content:
I am here because I am having an issue with google search and gmail. This is a continuation of two previous, archived posts: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1346146 and https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1357041

I have tried everything from windows uninstalls, program uninstalls, clearing cahce, nuking all addons, clearing history, changing network settings, starting in troubleshooting mode and nothing changes it.

I middle mouse click on a site in google search to open in a new tab and it does...but all it does is open that tab with the google search redirect link in the URL and the back, forward, and reload buttons grayed out. Nothing in inspect element either. At least in google search, after opening the link, when you go back and do it again it works fine. In Gmail (HTML Gmail at least, that's what I use), every single last email subject I open in a new tab to read the whole email fails spectatuclarly. And god forbid you want to click the sender name to see previous email replies...because this happens too with every reply. And now after clearing my google site history, I'm signed out of google services and can't sign back in because of this on my desktop. Help!!!
creator: steven.schiavone

content:

When I select save in the upper right corner of the displayed document a floating (no background or buttons) drop down menu with only one selection appears in the lower middle of the screen.

In documenting this I made a screenshot, and when I clicked it, it appeared in a Firefox Tab (normal behavior) but when I right clicked that and selected Save, another floating drop down menu appeared

title: ENO from Capital One
content:
I am having trouble with the ENO extension when I use Firefox. I click on the extension and it just spins and spins and spins. I have contacted Capital One about this at least six times. Every time I do I am told that it is working fine. I might be told to reboot, clear cache, etc. It might work once but then stops working.

When I use it on Chrome it always works fine. Every time. If I don't remember before I start a credit card transaction and use Firefox I end up when it is the time to use ENO and it does not work. Then I have to start over.

How can I get Capital One to put in some work on this? Can you help? I don't think ENO should be available for Firefox since it works so poorly.

Thanks

Jim Anderson anderson.jim.h@gmail.com

title: Upgrade to V-107 has affected a Corel product
content:

title: Administrador de contraseñas
content:
Siempre he usado Firefox pero sin registrarme.

Esta vez me he hecho una cuenta a que creo que gozaré de más ventajas, solo que ahora no hay manera de guardar mis inicios de sesión.

Tengo marcada la casilla "Preguntar para guardar contraseñas e inicios de sesión de sitios web" NO tengo guardada ninguna excepción de inicio de sesión. Y NO tengo el modo de navegación privada...

Aun así cuando intento configurar una contraseña maestra me dice "No se pudo cambiar la contraseña maestra"

Y si intento guardar un inicio de sesión de manera manual "Se produjo un error al intentar guardar la contraseña"

Me he leído todas las preguntas y respuestas que ofrecéis al respecto, pero cumplo todos los requisitos y aun así no me lo permite.

Espero me ayudéis

Gracias

title: Firefox miscalculates top edge in  Windows 11
content: Sometimes, Firefox launches with its title bar just off screen (and the menu bar sits against the top edge) so the mouse cannot reach the title bar controls. I find that if I drag the right edge of the window in a small amount, the title bar drops down a few pixels so I can see a few pixels of the title bar and its controls. So adjusting the right edge seems to cause a recalculation of the top edge. It suggests that on launch, there is a miscalculation. It would be nice to fix this - a minor irritation as I now have a workaround. Note - if I *drag* the title bar to the top of the window, the furthest 'north' I can go is this same position with a few pixels of the title bar showing - If I go further, the title bar ( not the whole window) jumps back to have this same part showing. regards Gareth HP Envy Win 11 NVidia HDR screen 3840x2160 (the recommended setting) with text set 200%

title: Passwords disapeared
content:
My saved logins vanished with no action on my side. I didn't delete any bookmarks or logins or anything Firefox related. I just try to login to a website and it there is no saved login prompt, I look and find all my passwords deleted. I hadn't updated FF or downgraded it.

I looked and did not find any solutions on any other help article, No, I did not make a backup of my Firefox, I foolishly trusted FF to work as good as internet edge or chrome. No, "login-backup" had nothing in it.
creator: slashplane

title: Someone interfered with my work, their bookmarks are getting synced to mine and having difficulties
content:
Hello moz://a,

I trust that this finds you in good faith,

My name is Kyle Santowski, I got dismissed from work in December and started focusing my attention on computers and the understanding thereof. I purchased the domain heartofstoneclothing.com using my Samsung A21s and my credit card.

I was visiting a friend at the time who offered the use of his computer to me as a kind gesture. I have been residing on the friends property since January and have been using that device up until recently. With my provident fund I purchased a laptop and have been using it since to recover most of my work.

My work got intercepted the day ICANN's 60 day holding period was over, since it wasn't my computer I had no say over it. In South Africa we have a problem with consistent power outages known as load shedding, long story short; I woke up from an extended nap to watch my work get taken and redirected.

I have had major 4 major confrontations with my friend, Gary, whether or not he was snooping through my files. Ive been lied to in my face 4 times, been sworn at, had pots and pans thrown at me for falsely accusing him. I let it go due to alternate accommodation difficulties. At the risk of losing my work completely I have allowed friend to run around the part my browser he gained access to. I might have unknowingly given it up, or at least part of it since it was not my computer.

In these altercations I have been chased away, but i could not leave my work on that computer. Not having access to an external hard drive and no time I mass dumped everything anywhere i could find space; My OneDrive, GoogleDrive, Dropbox. At the time i had just came across MDN after working on Firefox for the first time and exploring its glories.

I have bookmarks that don't belong to me in my bookmarks toolbar, there is personal information that is not mine getting sent to me and I have had to manage this person and his websites while sacrificing my own. I'm not entirely sure how to separate our work without, because the bookmarks i delete reappear every time and I no longer wish to use the old device.

I herewith kindly ask that i could receive some assistance with the issue, this situation has messed my brain up for months and I finally have an understanding of what i need to do, but I am quite new to working with software and can't afford to let it go askew.
creator: santowskikr

title: Youtube Constantly Buffering after Pausing and Resuming
content: I've been watching and following along with a Unreal Engine 4 Course on Youtube for some time now (mentioning in case the resource usage has something to do with it), and in the past couple days I've noticed a pretty serious and annoying bug. When I pause the video, tab (Cmd + Tab on MacOS) into Unreal Engine, do some things, then tab back and resume the video, it will play for one frame and then stop and buffer, but the audio will continue playing. The only way to get the video to resume is to skip forward/backward in the video (either with the arrow keys or the progress bar). I've also tried Troubleshooting/Safe mode and the issue still persits.
